result.execSummary:
The defendant Kyle James Anderson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine [Modifiers: Party to a Crime, Penalties for Felonies-Class "I" Felony], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: St Croix County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with Eau Claire County Case #14CF409.
Court notes 113 days credit if revoked.

 
In the event that the defendant is revoked or discharged from either probation or extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, the supervising agent shall notify the court 10 days prior to the revocation or discharge.  A civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victim(s) and/or governmental entities for any balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect all debt.
Concurrent with: Eau Claire County #14CF409

miscConds.notes:
$268.00 to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF361.
$250.00 DNA surcharge to be collected by DOC as a condition of probation in Count 1 Case #15CF361.
Zero controlled substances in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.
AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

CO: Lundell, RPR: Val Deiss, Clerk: Liddle ,ADA:   Edward Minser   DF ATTY:  Donald J. Schwab   DF:  Kyle James Anderson appeared from jail. Case called at 3:00 p.m. Atty Schwab states there is an agreement. ADA Minser recites agreement. Defendant is currently on a PO hold out of Eau Claire County. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads GUILTY to Ct 1 in 15CF361 WITHOUT enhancer.  Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1 WITHOUT enhancer in 15CF361. Sentencing arguments. Defendant makes statement. 20 days to file appeal.  Crt orders:

- S/W  2 years probation. If probation revoked, credit for 113 days jail. Concurrent with Eau Claire Co. Case 14CF409.

- AODA and follow any recommended treatment.

- $268.00 Court Costs, $250.00 DNA Surcharge and DNA Sample. Payable through probation. REFUND BOND

- Absolute sobriety with controlled substance

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF361 Kyle Anderson and 15CF362:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Kalli May Maxey appeared from jail. Case called at 2:40 p.m. ADA McKinley states that Mr. Anderson was transported to Eau Claire Co on a PO Hold and they will need to file an Order to Transport. 15CF362: Atty Yacoub has a copy of the information. Court reviews charges, penalties and rights. Atty Yacoub waives further reading of the information. Joint request for substiution of judge. Atty Schwab needs his client to sign and agree to the substitution of judge. Court will take defendant's plea today and reserve right for substitution of judge. Enter NG plea's on all counts. Atty Yacoub requesting bond modification. ADA McKinley objects to a signature bond. Atty Yacoub states defendant is currently on a PO Hold. Court will deny the request to modify bond at this time. This case will be reassigned and can be brought up with the new judge. Atty Yacoub filing a discovery request.
filed by ADA Alexis McKinley. eif

TO ALSO INCLUDE 15CF361 and 15CF362:
CO: RMW, REP: Drost, CLERK: Liddle. ADA:   Alexis S. Mckinley   DF ATTY:  Sarah Slice Yacoub   DF:  Kalli May Maxey appeared from jail. DF: Kyle James Anderson appeared from jail. DF ATTY: Donald J Schwab. Case called at 3:38 p.m. State calls Deputy Andrew Dittman to the stand. S/T Deputy Andrew Dittman. Direct by ADA McKinley. Deputy Dittman identifies defendant Kalli Maxey in the courtroom. Deputy Dittman identifies defendant Kyle Anderson in the courtroom. Ms. Maxey gave a false name at the time of arrest. Cross by Atty Yacoub. Cross by Atty Schwab. Deputy excused at 3:59 p.m. Atty Schwab has no more evidence. Atty Yacoub has a Motion to Dismiss. Atty Schwab to join in the Motion to Dismiss. ADA McKinley gives argument. Court is satisfied that a felony was probably committed, that the state has met the burden of proof and binds defendant over for trial. No request from either party to modify bond at this time.  Arraignment scheduled for August 17, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
